title: ICE: `escaping bound vars in predicate Obligation` in `inherited.rs`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
Found this while minimizing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/109054 :smile: So maybe related? [These](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+escaping+bound+vars+label%3AI-ICE) didn't seem like duplicates. ### Code ```Rust #![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)] struct S; type ReturnType<'a> = impl Eq + 'a; impl std::ops::Deref for S { type Target = dyn Fn(&()) -> ReturnType; fn deref() -> &'static Self::Target {} } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (511364e78 2023-03-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 511364e7874dba9649a264100407e4bffe7b5425 commit-date: 2023-03-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_hir_typeck/src/inherited.rs:105:13: escaping bound vars in predicate Obligation(predicate=Binder(TraitPredicate( as std::marker::Sized>, polarity:Positive), []), depth=0) --> melted.rs:6:19 | 6 | fn deref() -> &'static Self::Target {} | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/511364e7874dba9649a264100407e4bffe7b5425/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:995:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f4bd00b250a - @rustbot label +S-bug-has-mcve +F-type_alias_impl_trait
